cn.edu.xjtu.se.jackq

Class PatternRecognition

  • java.lang.Object
    • cn.edu.xjtu.se.jackq.PatternRecognition

  • public class PatternRecognition
extends java.lang.Object
    Provide static methods as utility to check some pattern in an array

    This class only contains static methods and constants, don't instantiate this class.

    Author:
    Jack Q (qiaobo@outlook.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private PatternRecognition()
      Null implementation of default constructor to avoid instantiation of this class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void autoTest()
      provide some test cases for isConsecutiveFour(int[][])
      static boolean isConsecutiveFour(int[][] values)
      test whether a two-dimensional array has four consecutive numbers of the same value, either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      a test program that prompts the user to enter the number of rows and columns of a two-dimensional array and then the values in the array and displays true if the array contains four consecutive numbers with the same value.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Null implementation of default constructor to avoid instantiation of this class

    • Method Detail

      • isConsecutiveFour

        public static boolean isConsecutiveFour(int[][] values)
        test whether a two-dimensional array has four consecutive numbers of the same value, either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

        For the two-dimensional array, it must has the same number of columns in each row. Otherwise, this program may raise ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

        Parameters:
        values - a 2D array of integers
        Returns:
        true if there are four consecutive numbers of the same value

      • autoTest

        public static void autoTest()
        provide some test cases for isConsecutiveFour(int[][])

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        a test program that prompts the user to enter the number of rows and columns of a two-dimensional array and then the values in the array and displays true if the array contains four consecutive numbers with the same value. This is the entry point of this program.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed to this program.
        switch -a: use existed data to test the program
